page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Green Park Railway Station was opened on the 5th of August 1869 and was built by the midland railway company. The station was busiest between the wars. The hight of the season was the summer holidays when special trips were organised to the seaside. Many different trains were seen and it was a popular place for train spotting. Following nationilisation the station became less busy, it was considered to be 'un-yielding'and was closed on the 21st of September 1953. For almost 30 years the city council argued about the possible uses of this site, some suggestions were a zoo, sports centre, hotel and conference centre.Meanwhile the site fell into disrepair.In 1980 sainsbury's bought the site and restored the station.
